intro: Hedyotis trichoclada, commonly known as the hairy buttonweed, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes approximately 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy leaves, which give it its common name. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or wetlands. Hedyotis trichoclada is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
